description: Construction of a 3 storey building comprising a nursery (Class E(f)) with associated cycle parking, landscaping, refuse storage and associated works
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): Proposed Site Plan (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-09-09); Proposed Ground Floor Plan (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-10); Proposed First Floor Plan (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-11); Proposed Second Floor Plan (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-12); Proposed Roof Plan (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-13); Proposed North East Elevation (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-61); Proposed South East Section/Elevation (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-62); Proposed South East Elevation (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-63); Proposed South West Section/Elevation (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-64); Proposed North West Section/Elevation (ref. 3206-CB-A-DR-10-65)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All materials to be used for the external surfaces of the hereby approved development shall be in accordance with the details and annotations of the hereby approved drawings listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the Ealing Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), polices 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policy D4 of the Publication London Plan (2020).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a Demolition Method Statement / Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include the following:
(a) Control measures for noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014);
(b) Control measures for dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition);
(c) Control measures for lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals);
(d) Delivery locations and schedule;
(e) Heavy goods vehicles and crane tracking diagrams;
(f) Hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to be restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays; and

(g) Neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, and to ensure the construction phase does not result in adverse harm to the safety of the local transport network in accordance with policies 5.3, 6.3 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) and D14, SI 1, T3, T4, and T7 of the Publication London Plan (2020) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the first use of the development hereby approved, a Noise Management Plan designed to ensure the noise emitted from the internal and external areas of the approved nursery do not exceed levels detrimental to the amenity provided by adjoining properties shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must include details on (but not limited to):
-	 A noise assessment of outdoor use by children and adults, including details on reverberated noise between buildings.
-	 Noise mitigation measures of likely external noise emissions at full potential capacity and assessment of noise impacts on neighbours.
-	 Hours of operation of the hereby approved nursery.
-	 Hours of use of external amenity/play spaces with confirmation that the external amenity areas will not be used before 8am or after 6pm.
-	 The maximum number of children allowed in the garden/play space at one given time.
-	 Potential staggering of drop-offs and collections.

-	 Details of the sound insulation of the building envelope and likely noise breakout, including glazing specifications (laboratory sound insulation including frames, seals and ventilators tested and approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010)
The operation of the approved development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises are not adversely affected by noise from the use or from people attending or leaving the site and in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) policy D14 of The Publication London Plan (2020), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The number of persons occupying the nursery at any time shall be restricted to a maximum 90 children.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020) policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration.

| A minimum of six (6) cycle storage spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with the location identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The cycle storage area shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), policy T5 of the Publication London Plan 2020 and Supplementary Planning Guidance (Housing) (2012).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building as indicated on the approved plans and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and S18 & S19 of the Publication London Plan (2020).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises are not adversely affected by vibration noise, in accordance with policies D3 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out I the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 5.3 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policies D3 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out only in conjunction with the lawful implementation of planning permission 203935FUL for the "Construction of two and three storey building comprising 9 residential units; and provision of associated private amenity areas, cycle parking, landscaping, refuse storage and associated works (following demolition of existing buildings)"

Reason: To ensure that the development does not result in a loss of social infrastructure in accordance with policies 3.16 and 3.18 of the London Plan (2016) and S1 and S3 of the Publication London Plan (2020).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) or the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2020, the development hereby approved shall only be used as a Nursery (Use Class E(f)), and not for any other use without prior approval from the Local Planning Authority through a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality and provision of any change of use, and to protect the character of the area and the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policies D4 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020), policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), SPG 10, and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
